title.narrative: Strengthening Standardization, Quality Assurance, Accreditation and Metrology (SQAM) Infrastructure in Kazakhstan

description.narrative: On 2 May 2014, UNIDO and the Government of Kazakhstan signed a Joint Declaration on Cooperation that aims to contribute to the country#s efforts towards industrialization as stipulated in the State Program of Accelerated Industrial-Innovative Development of Kazakhstan for 2015-2019 (SPAIID), through, in particular, adoption and implementation of the UNIDO Country Programme Framework (CPF) for Kazakhstan that prioritizes, inter alia, Industrial Modernization. As part of the CPF, three technical cooperation projects were prioritized by the Government of Kazakhstan with respective allocation of Preparatory Assistance phase funding for development of fully fledged project documents to be submitted for consideration of funding for these projects# main phases by the Government of Kazakhstan. The overall development objective of the current project is to enhance the existing quality infrastructure (standards, metrology and accreditation institutions as well as conformity assessment services such as laboratories, inspection bodies and certification bodies) to support light industry in Kazakhstan, with particular emphasis on the processed food value chain, unlocking its export market potential especially for SMEs. The project will strengthen and support Kazakhstan#s capacity for trade along the processed food value cha
